g.text: Up to your dApp but you can put some device
validation on here like email validation etc
before you return the encrypted key.
Use the authentication token as a way to identify
Get the encrypted key info for the user:
Makes sure the stored auth token matches the one sending in before returning the encrypted info
If you are not using node as your backend the github
readme explains what this method does so you can
write it in the language your using.
If false do not carry on and return
and 4xx http code back to your client.
Done - if your dApp uses backend calls throughout you should probably
return some kind of authentication token at this point. Again its up to
You can use the private key to do any signing
